serverActions.title: Server Actions API
serverActions.subtitle: Welcome to the DeepTrans Studio Server Actions API documentation center! This guide aims to help you get started quickly, understand how to effectively use the interactive features provided in this documentation to test and understand DeepTrans Studio Server Actions, and master the key elements of API access.

importantNote.title: Important Note:
content: This page content: Mainly introduces the interactive methods of Server Actions documentation, global access configuration (such as Base URL, authentication information), and documentation contribution process.

API endpoint details: All specific Server Actions (including their parameters, request/response structures, function descriptions, and examples) are automatically generated from our code and include the latest feature annotations. Please be sure to consult these auto-generated pages to get the most accurate and detailed endpoint information.

accessApi.title: Access API
accessApi.description: Or click the "Access API" tab in the top navigation bar to view the complete API documentation.

interactiveTesting.title: Interactive API Testing
interactiveTesting.description: To help you quickly verify and understand the API, most Server Actions endpoint pages in this documentation have embedded "Try It" interactive testing functionality.

steps.title: Locate 'Try It' Feature
steps.description: On the Server Actions endpoint documentation page you want to test, usually at the top or right side of the page, you will find an obvious "Try It" button or directly interactive parameter input area.

steps.title: Send Request and View Results
steps.description: After all parameters are configured, click the "Send" (or "Execute") button to initiate the API call. Shortly after, you will see the complete response returned by the API in the same area, including HTTP status code, response headers, and response body.

baseUrl.title: Server Address (Base URL)
baseUrl.description: The base URL for Server Actions requests varies depending on your DeepTrans Studio deployment environment:
baseUrl.note: When making Server Actions calls or using the "Try It" feature, please make sure the Base URL you configured is correct.

authentication.title: Authentication Information (Session Token)
authentication.description: DeepTrans Studio uses NextAuth for authentication, and Server Actions automatically obtain user information from the session.
methods: Browser Environment: Server Actions automatically use the current logged-in user's session information, no need to manually pass authentication information.
Server-side Calls: If you are calling Server Actions on the server side, you need to ensure that the request context includes a valid user session.
API Routes: For features that need to be accessed through API routes, please use NextAuth's Session Token for authentication.

securityNote.title: Important Security Note:
content: Session Token is a credential for accessing your application data and has high permissions. Please treat it as sensitive information and keep it safe. Never hardcode or directly expose it in any client-side code (such as browser or mobile app frontend).
It is recommended to store authentication information in a secure server-side environment and proxy calls to DeepTrans Studio Server Actions through backend services.
